pairs.subject: Upcoming Employee Training Session
pairs.desc:
Dear Team,

We are excited to announce an upcoming training session scheduled for next week. This session will cover important topics that are essential for your professional development. Please find the training details attached.

Date: March 15, 2023
Time: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM
Location: Conference Room B

We highly encourage everyone to attend as it will provide valuable insights and skills that will benefit your roles.

Best regards,
HR Team
pairs.explain: This email is from HR with a legitimate training attachment and contains clear details about the session.

pairs.subject: Important: Action Required for Training Session
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

You are required to download the attached file to confirm your attendance for the mandatory training session. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary action.

Please ensure you complete this by the end of the day.

Thank you,
HR Department
pairs.explain: This email uses urgency and an executable attachment to trick the recipient into downloading malware.

pairs.subject: Quarterly Financial Report
pairs.desc:
Hello Team,

Attached you will find the quarterly financial report for your review. Please take the time to go through the document and prepare any questions for our upcoming meeting.

Your insights are valuable, and we look forward to discussing this in detail.

Best,
Finance Team
pairs.explain: This email is from the Finance department with a legitimate PDF attachment containing the quarterly report.

pairs.subject: Urgent: Financial Report Review Needed
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

Please find the attached financial report that requires your immediate attention. You must review it and send back your feedback by the end of the day.

Failure to comply may affect your performance review.

Regards,
Finance Team
pairs.explain: This email creates a false sense of urgency and includes a dangerous executable attachment.

pairs.subject: IT System Maintenance Notification
pairs.desc:
Dear All,

We would like to inform you that there will be scheduled maintenance on our IT systems this weekend. The downtime will occur from Saturday 10 PM to Sunday 6 AM.

Please save your work accordingly and plan ahead.

Thank you for your understanding.

Best,
IT Department
pairs.explain: This email provides clear information about scheduled maintenance without any attachments.

pairs.subject: Immediate Action Required: IT System Update
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

We have detected an issue with your account that requires immediate action. Please run the attached file to update your settings.

Failure to do so may lead to account suspension.

Regards,
IT Support
pairs.explain: This email attempts to manipulate the recipient into running a malicious script disguised as an update.

pairs.subject: Travel Itinerary Confirmation
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

Your travel itinerary for the upcoming business trip has been confirmed. Please find the details attached.

If you have any questions or need to make changes, feel free to reach out.

Safe travels!

Best,
Travel Department
pairs.explain: This email contains a legitimate attachment with travel details and is from the authorized travel department.

pairs.subject: Action Needed: Travel Itinerary Update
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

There has been an urgent update to your travel itinerary. Please download and open the attached file to view the changes.

Failure to do this may result in missed flights.

Thank you,
Travel Team
pairs.explain: This email uses urgency and includes a harmful executable attachment to deceive the recipient.

pairs.subject: Security Awareness Training Reminder
pairs.desc:
Hello Team,

This is a friendly reminder to complete your Security Awareness Training by the end of the month. It is crucial for maintaining the safety of our company data.

If you have already completed it, thank you! If not, please prioritize this.

Best,
Security Team
pairs.explain: This email is a reminder with no attachments and encourages compliance with training requirements.

pairs.subject: Urgent: Security Training Completion Required
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

You have not yet completed your Security Awareness Training. Please download and run the attached file to finish the training.

This is mandatory and must be completed immediately.

Regards,
Security Department
pairs.explain: This email pressures the recipient to download a malicious executable under the guise of training completion.
